reviewText: I ordered these 2 movies separately! I wish I had seen this! I have waited so long for these to go to DVD! Why OH Why does it take so long to put these "OLDIES BUT GOODIES" on DVD's This is even a better price plus You can play ONE after another! My personnel favorite The one with Rick Roberts in it! But each is very good! PETER FALK Is at the Top of His games! Really great way to celebrate the Christmas Season! Plus It is cheaper to get ALL 3 in one!
Great movie  Peter fall is amazing highly recommended

A really fun series.  Thank you so much to the customer who suggested getting the trilogy, as opposed to the same movies separately.  It saved us money, as well as gave us a few nights in a row of fun entertainment.  The 3rd move -- "When Angels Come to Town" -- wasn't as good, nor was it of the caliber the first 2 were, but it was still ok. They seemed to be reaching and a little lost where to go with it, but the first two were VERY good.

Imagine Columbo as an angel.  Peter Falk is up to his usual - a decent and intelligent older "man" who puts on an air of bumbling foolishness.  The end result is a series of heartwarming classics that follow a formula without seeming formulaic.  We waited so long for these movies to come to DVD, and they did not disappoint.

After seeing these three movies on TV, I searched for them on the internet and in stores for a couple of years but I could not find them. Then last fall, all three were being offered on Amazon. Before I purchased them, I discovered all of them in this 3 pack - what a deal! I liked Peter Falk as a detective but I think I like him even better as the helpful angel Max in these movies. Each movie has its own flavor and they hold your attention to see how Max will intervene in the lives of the characters in the stories. But my favorite one is Finding John Christmas. The story and plot are realistic, except for Max, and I love any story, true or fiction, written about firefighters. After a tragic school fire, the fireman disappeared and left his mother and sister missing him for years. Then a photographer took a picture of a stranger in town and it appeared in the local newspaper. Kathleen, the sister, was convinced that this unidentified stranger was her missing brother Hank. With the help of the photographer and a few individuals, who all have a strange resemblance to Max, Kathleen follows the clues to find the stranger, now called "John Christmas" by the newspaper. Your heart is touched as the sister of the lost firefighter searches desperately for her long lost brother. When the truth about the heroic firefighter is revealed, he is able to deal with the feelings of guilt and failure that have plagued him. With the love of his family drawing him back and a little special help from Max the angel, Hank is reunited with his family in a warm and fitting ending. I am excited to finally have these three excellent movies in my collection.

I am not going to tell the stories of theses movies but will say they are fun movies to watch if you like the sit back watch a Christmas movie. These movies are not great but are enjoyable to watch any time.
